title: Dollar firm as investors mull a Fed under Warsh; yen back under the spotlight
summary: By Rae Wee SINGAPORE, Feb 2 (Reuters) - The dollar clung to its gains on Monday as investors weighed what a Federal Reserve under Kevin Warsh might look like, with his preference for a smaller balance

title: Rupee stares at new low beyond 92 on offshore-led dollar rush, weak Asia
summary: By Nimesh Vora MUMBAI, Jan 29 (Reuters) - The Indian rupee is poised to breach the 92-per-dollar level for the first time at open on Thursday, pressured by the U.S. dollar's rally in the non-

title: Singapore’s Central Bank Stays on Hold as It Raises Inflation Forecasts
summary: Singapore’s central bank kept monetary-policy settings steady at its first meeting of the year, forecasting hotter inflation and relatively solid growth.

title: Dollar Slides as Fed Rate Check Fuels Japan FX Intervention Speculation
summary: The Bloomberg Dollar Spot Index hits a September low as yen surges and investors assess possible US-Japan currency coordination.

title: Dollar Pressure Mounts as Traders Reopen Debasement Debate
summary: The yen jumped and the dollar weakened on Monday as investors decided the so-called rate check was the biggest sign yet of official disquiet toward the sliding Japanese currency and that the next step could be an intervention to buoy it.

title: Gold dips, stocks lift as Trump walks back Greenland threats
summary: By Tom Westbrook SINGAPORE, Jan 22 (Reuters) - The dollar was higher, gold softer and stocks on the rebound on Thursday after U.S.

title: Yen Could Recover if Breaks Beyond 154.50 Per Dollar
summary: The Japanese yen might sustain a recovery if it breaks sustainably beyond key chart support at 154.50 yen per dollar, Societe Generale said.

title: StraitsX to debut Singapore and U.S. dollar stablecoins on Solana for quick currency exchange
summary: The debut will enable instant swaps between SGD and USD on Solana, facilitating digital forex trading.

title: Standard Chartered, Coinbase Expand Crypto Prime Services for Institutions
summary: The companies will explore the development of trading, prime services, custody, staking and lending solutions for institutional clients.

title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.92% This Week to 97.53
summary: FOREIGN EXCHANGE The WSJ Dollar Index is up 0.89 point or 0.92% this week to 97.53 —Largest one-week point and percentage gain since the week ending Oct 10, 2025 —Up four of the past five weeks  —Today it is down 0.
